title: Simon Cowell ends explosive feud with Sharon Osbourne over the phone
text:

Simon Cowell has buried the hatchet with Sharon Osbourne after a bitter feud.

In March Sharon claimed Simon booted her off ITV show X Factor for being too old – an accusation which left his camp reeling.

Then two months later, the 66-year-old said she would never work with the music mogul again, blasting: “I can’t work with Simon Cowell I’m not a bulls ** and he can't deal with people that tell him the truth.”

She also previously labelled Cowell a “fing pain in the a” who “will do whatever” to get his “fing fat face on TV” and said she wanted to DROWN him.

She also branded performers on X Factor as “fing karaoke”, adding that they are “little sh***”.

But talking to the Mirror ahead of tomorrow night’s BGT: the Champions final, Cowell said that him and Sharon had subsequently been in touch since her incendiary comments to clear the air.

(Image: PA)

And he has even left open the door for her to return to a future version of the show.

He said: “I phoned her up the other day and said “Look, I’ll be honest with you.

"How could I criticise you for being mouthy when it’s the reason I hired you in the first place?!

"Sharon gets a bit carried away but deep down she’s got real affection for the shows.

“There will be other versions of these shows, I am sure, and she is always welcome back. If ever she had an issue, I’d be on a plane in 5 seconds, she’d do the same for me.

(Image: Thames/Syco/REX/Shutterstock)

(Image: PA)

“I know that about her. There’s absolutely no bad blood at all and I like I said, when people think I’m annoyed with her, I’m not! She’s a good friend and always will be.”

Sharon claimed earlier this year she had snubbed other work in the US on the Fox network to work on X Factor before being dropped.

She said: “I turned down the show Masked Singer. I was signed on to do another show at the time.

(Image: Getty)

"I was signed to go to England and then Simon changed hi mind and thought I was too old. Simon goes, ‘She’s old, we need somebody young’.”

Speaking on US show The Talk, she took a further swipe at Cowell, saying: “So, if you want young, fire yourself and get rid of those man-t*ts.”

Britain’s Got Talent: The Champions continues Saturday at 8.30pm on ITV
